title: Vermont Debates Adopting Latin Motto
teaser: The state already has a motto in English,  but a 15-year-old has been lobbying for an additional phrase she found on an old coin.
contentencoded:
Vermont lawmakers are deciding whether to adopt what many other states already have: a Latin motto.

The state already has a motto in English, “Freedom and Unity,” but a 15-year-old Latin scholar has been lobbying for an additional phrase, which she found on an old coin.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Charlotte Albright of Vermont Public Radio reports.
